Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course

Class Activity

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.Activity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Conflict
Direct Known Subclasses:
Course
public abstract class Activity extends Object implements Conflict
Abstract super class of Course and Event that holds the common instance fields between the two title, meeting days, start time, and end time. Allows the scheduler system to hold both Course and Event objects in the same ArrayList to provide greater functionality between the two classes. Activity also abstracts both Course and Event methods getShortDisplayArray and getLongDisplayArray.
Author:
Geigh Neill

  • Constructor Details

    • Activity

      public Activity(String title, String meetingDays, int startTime, int endTime)
      Activity's constructor provides a foundation for when the child classes event and course are constructed but is never constructed directly on its own. Common fields such as title meeting days, start time, and end time are set here for Event and Course classes.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Activity
      meetingDays - The meeting days of the Activity
      startTime - The start time of the Activity
      endTime - The end time of the Activity

      public abstract boolean isDuplicate(Activity activity)
      Checks for duplicates of an Event or Course in WolfScheduler before adding an Activity.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      Whether the activity has a duplicate or not

    • checkConflict

      public void checkConflict(Activity possibleConflictingActivity) throws ConflictException
      Checks whether there is a conflict when adding an Activity to schedule. Iterates through getMeetingDays() string comparing the characters in it to the getMeetingDays() of the parameter. If a matching character is found boolean dayMatch is set to true. When dayMatch is true checkConflict will find which Activity, this or parameter, has the latest starting time and use that to determine whether there is or is not a conflict. If a conflict is present ConflictException is thrown. Overridden because comes from Conflict interface.
      Specified by:
      checkConflict in interface Conflict
      Parameters:
      possibleConflictingActivity - Activity being checked for conflict
      Throws:
      ConflictException - When a conflict is present between Activities
